title: Bleeding Gastric Ulcer
diagnosis_topic: Hemorrhage from a gastric ulcer requiring endoscopic and medical management
setup_script: “A 50-year-old man presents to the emergency department with hematemesis and melena. He reports multiple episodes of vomiting blood over the past 6 hours and several days of black stools. He has a history of chronic NSAID use for back pain. On arrival, he appears pale and fatigued. How would you proceed in managing this patient?”

dynamic_flow.reply: BP 100/60 mmHg, HR 110 bpm, RR 20/min, Temp 37 °C; patient appears pale and diaphoretic.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident establishes large-bore IV access and initiates resuscitation
dynamic_flow.reply: Crystalloid given, 1 unit PRBC transfused, Hgb 7.2 g/dL.
CBC: Hgb 8 g/dL, platelets 200K/µL; INR 1.0; BUN 40 mg/dL, Cr 1.2 mg/dL.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident starts IV proton pump inhibitor
dynamic_flow.reply: Pantoprazole bolus followed by continuous infusion is administered.
Aspirates bright red blood confirming ongoing upper GI bleeding.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident consults gastroenterology for urgent endoscopy
dynamic_flow.reply: Endoscopy reveals a 1 cm gastric ulcer with a visible vessel. Epinephrine injection and clipping performed.
Patient develops worsening hypotension and requires escalation of transfusion.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident requests repeat endoscopy after rebleeding
dynamic_flow.reply: Repeat endoscopic therapy performed with thermal coagulation.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident escalates to interventional radiology
dynamic_flow.reply: Angiographic embolization of left gastric artery performed with stabilization.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident opts for surgery after failed interventions
dynamic_flow.reply: Exploratory laparotomy performed; bleeding ulcer oversewn with truncal vagotomy and pyloroplasty. Examiner prompt: “Please describe in detail the technical steps of this operative procedure.”
Resident describes laparotomy, exposure, identification of bleeding ulcer, oversewing of bleeding vessel, vagotomy and pyloroplasty.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident omits critical operative steps
dynamic_flow.reply: Patient remains unstable with continued bleeding; examiner asks: “Is there anything else you would include in your operative management?”

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident orders H. pylori testing
dynamic_flow.reply: Biopsy taken; positive result confirmed; eradication therapy initiated.

dynamic_flow.trigger: If resident advises discontinuation of NSAIDs and initiation of PPI maintenance
dynamic_flow.reply: Patient counseled on alternative analgesics and long-term PPI therapy.
Biopsies obtained from ulcer edge; pathology pending.
Patient advised on medication adherence, avoidance of NSAIDs, completion of H. pylori therapy, and follow-up endoscopy.

critical_decision_points: Initial hemodynamic stabilization and transfusion strategy
Early initiation of IV PPI therapy
Appropriate use of urgent endoscopy for diagnosis and hemostasis
Recognition of rebleeding and escalation to embolization or surgery
Ability to describe operative steps for surgical management of bleeding gastric ulcer
Testing for and treating H. pylori infection
Long-term ulcer prevention and surveillance for malignancy
